speaker: EROS
text_entry: SCENE VI. Rome. OCTAVIUS CAESAR's house.

speaker: EROS
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIUS CAESAR, AGRIPPA, and MECAENAS

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Contemning Rome, he has done all this, and more,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: In Alexandria: here's the manner of 't:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I' the market-place, on a tribunal silver'd,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Cleopatra and himself in chairs of gold

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Were publicly enthroned: at the feet sat

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Caesarion, whom they call my father's son,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And all the unlawful issue that their lust

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Since then hath made between them. Unto her

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: He gave the stablishment of Egypt; made her

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of lower Syria, Cyprus, Lydia,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Absolute queen.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: This in the public eye?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I' the common show-place, where they exercise.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: His sons he there proclaim'd the kings of kings:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Great Media, Parthia, and Armenia.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: He gave to Alexander; to Ptolemy he assign'd

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Syria, Cilicia, and Phoenicia: she

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: In the habiliments of the goddess Isis

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That day appear'd; and oft before gave audience,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: As 'tis reported, so.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Let Rome be thus Inform'd.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Who, queasy with his insolence

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Already, will their good thoughts call from him.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The people know it; and have now received

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: His accusations.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Who does he accuse?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Caesar: and that, having in Sicily

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Sextus Pompeius spoil'd, we had not rated him

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: His part o' the isle: then does he say, he lent me

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Some shipping unrestored: lastly, he frets

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That Lepidus of the triumvirate

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Should be deposed; and, being, that we detain

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: All his revenue.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Sir, this should be answer'd.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: 'Tis done already, and the messenger gone.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I have told him, Lepidus was grown too cruel;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That he his high authority abused,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And did deserve his change: for what I have conquer'd,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I grant him part; but then, in his Armenia,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And other of his conquer'd kingdoms, I

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Demand the like.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: He'll never yield to that.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Nor must not then be yielded to in this.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Enter OCTAVIA with her train

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Hail, Caesar, and my lord! hail, most dear Caesar!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: That ever I should call thee castaway!

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: You have not call'd me so, nor have you cause.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Why have you stol'n upon us thus! You come not

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Like Caesar's sister: the wife of Antony

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Should have an army for an usher, and

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The neighs of horse to tell of her approach

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Long ere she did appear; the trees by the way

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Should have borne men; and expectation fainted,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Longing for what it had not; nay, the dust

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Should have ascended to the roof of heaven,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Raised by your populous troops: but you are come

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: A market-maid to Rome; and have prevented

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The ostentation of our love, which, left unshown,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Is often left unloved; we should have met you

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: By sea and land; supplying every stage

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: With an augmented greeting.

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Good my lord,

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: To come thus was I not constrain'd, but did

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: On my free will. My lord, Mark Antony,

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Hearing that you prepared for war, acquainted

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: My grieved ear withal; whereon, I begg'd

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: His pardon for return.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Which soon he granted,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Being an obstruct 'tween his lust and him.

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Do not say so, my lord.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: I have eyes upon him,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And his affairs come to me on the wind.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Where is he now?

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: My lord, in Athens.

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: No, my most wronged sister; Cleopatra

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Hath nodded him to her. He hath given his empire

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Up to a whore; who now are levying

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The kings o' the earth for war; he hath assembled

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Bocchus, the king of Libya; Archelaus,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of Cappadocia; Philadelphos, king

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of Paphlagonia; the Thracian king, Adallas;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: King Malchus of Arabia; King of Pont;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Herod of Jewry; Mithridates, king

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of Comagene; Polemon and Amyntas,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: The kings of Mede and Lycaonia,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: With a more larger list of sceptres.

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Ay me, most wretched,

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: That have my heart parted betwixt two friends

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: That do afflict each other!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Welcome hither:

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Your letters did withhold our breaking forth;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Till we perceived, both how you were wrong led,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And we in negligent danger. Cheer your heart;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Be you not troubled with the time, which drives

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: O'er your content these strong necessities;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: But let determined things to destiny

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Hold unbewail'd their way. Welcome to Rome;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Nothing more dear to me. You are abused

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Beyond the mark of thought: and the high gods,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: To do you justice, make them ministers

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Of us and those that love you. Best of comfort;

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: And ever welcome to us.

speaker: AGRIPPA
text_entry: Welcome, lady.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Welcome, dear madam.

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Each heart in Rome does love and pity you:

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: Only the adulterous Antony, most large

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: In his abominations, turns you off;

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: And gives his potent regiment to a trull,

speaker: MECAENAS
text_entry: That noises it against us.

speaker: OCTAVIA
text_entry: Is it so, sir?

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Most certain. Sister, welcome: pray you,

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Be ever known to patience: my dear'st sister!

speaker: OCTAVIUS CAESAR
text_entry: Exeunt
